docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: A political dissident recently released from a Soviet psychiatric hospital said today that the habitual use of punitive psychiatric treatment in the Soviet Union remained unchanged despite recent criticisms of such practices in the Soviet press.

headline.main: Reports of Psychiatry Abuse Counter Talk of a Soviet Shift

docs.snippet: LEAD: A political dissident recently released from a Soviet psychiatric hospital said today that the habitual use of punitive psychiatric treatment in the Soviet Union remained unchanged despite recent criticisms of such practices in the Soviet...

byline.original: By FELCITY BARRINGER, Special to the New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Women with AIDS are sicker and are dying more quickly than men who have the disease, a finding that is shocking and puzzling AIDS researchers.

headline.main: AIDS Is Killing Women Faster, Researchers Say

docs.snippet: LEAD: Women with AIDS are sicker and are dying more quickly than men who have the disease, a finding that is shocking and puzzling AIDS researchers.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Weeks This Last On Week Fiction Week List 1 PRESUMED INNOCENT, by Scott Turow. 1 17 (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $18.95.) A brutal murder creates a crisis among a big city's politicans and lawyers. 2 HEAVEN AND HELL, by John Jakes. (Harcourt 3 3 Brace Jovanovich, $19.95.) A tale of two families, the Mains of South Carolina and the Hazards of Pennsylvania, in the aftermath of the Civil War.
